Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer's use of faulty speakers violated the Applicant's right to a fair test under natural justice principles
Outcome: The application for judicial review is allowed
Procedural_Context: Appeal against the visa officer's decision focusing on technical malfunction during the test
Evidence_Type: Technical issues affecting communication during English test
Basis_of_Claim: Breach of natural justice due to unfair testing conditions
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Faulty speakers impacting fairness of English proficiency assessment
Application_Error: Use of unreliable audio equipment during language test
Review_Outcome: Applicant will be retested by a different visa officer
Assessment_Standard: Fair opportunity to demonstrate qualifications under natural justice
Legal_Standard: Natural justice – fair opportunity to demonstrate qualifications
Application_Factor: Technical difficulties during English language test
Decision_Review_Issue: Fairness of test administration due to technical issues
Cause_of_Refusal: Compromised test due to faulty equipment
Evidentiary_Issues: Acknowledged sporadic speaker issues affecting communication
Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to proceeding with test despite technical problems
Procedural_Issue: Failure to ensure functional equipment for fair testing
